job_description:
Company Overview:
KWESST develops and delivers next generation military and public safety technology for military and first responder customers. The company is proudly Canadian and provides Dismounted/Mounted Domain Expertise in Command-and-Control software development, integration and support services.
Job Description:
KWESST is seeking talented individuals with an expertise in the Canadian and international defence C4ISR domain to offer specialized software development and integration solutions to the Canadian Army through the Defence Software Engineering Facility (DSEF). They will be actively involved in all aspects of the software development cycle with a focus on increasing system integrity, performance, reliability, and maintainability. They will also manage, and support activities related to DLSCPM test environments, including various unclassified and classified test lab environments, at various service levels, and support any additional communities of interest and technical environments as needed.
The Senior Software Architect will be responsible for performing the below tasks.
Job Responsibilities:
Develop technical architectures, frameworks and strategies to meet DSEF software development and application requirements.
Analyze, design and implement DSEF software and application architectures.
Design, develop and assess technical options for DSEF software development and application problems.
Analyze and evaluate alternative technology solutions to meet DSEF software development and application problems.
Ensure the integration of all aspects of DSEF software solutions.
Recommend options for resolving DSEF software design issues.
Analyze functional requirements to identify information, procedures and decision flows for DSEF applications.
Evaluate existing procedures and methods, identify and document database content, structure, and application sub-systems, and develop data dictionary.
Define and document interfaces of manual-to-automated operations within application subsystems, to external systems and between new and existing systems.
Identify and document system specific standards relating to programming, documentation and testing, covering program libraries, data dictionaries, and naming conventions; and
Perform any other Work related to this category.

Mandatory Qualifications:
I. Experience:
Minimum of 10 years of demonstrated experience as a Software Architect on Military C2 systems.
Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated experience as a Software Architect within an IPT for an onsite client.
Minimum of 15 years of demonstrated experience in 4 of the following:
Client/Server architecture and related technologies.
Analyzing, designing, and implementing software architectures.
Communication engineering and systems security (Hardware, software, and network), including cryptographic key, devices, hardware, firmware, or software that embodies or describes cryptographic logic).
Experience on Real-time systems, Distributed systems, Embedded systems, or Mission critical systems.
Data architecture definition, framework, and implementation for military systems.
Software Integration: hardware and software (COTS and/ or custom developed) components into new or existing systems.
Employing computer modelling or simulation tool to complete software performance studies or development.
Demonstrated experience in the field of Firepower, ISR, C4ISR, or Modelling and Simulation application development.
Software life-cycle management.
Minimum of 8 years of demonstrated experience in preparation of technical concept documents, system specifications, and technical proposals in the field of Information Technology/ Information management or engineering.
Minimum of 10 years of demonstrated experience in a minimum of 4 of the following:
Communicating information technology frameworks/strategies to management and technical staff.
Communicating system engineering direction for projects or systems.
Providing advice, guidance and recommendations on technical issues to support the decision-making of senior management.
Leading multidisciplinary teams in the development of IT tactical systems, frameworks or strategies; or
Performing strategic, operational or tactical planning for projects or systems to meet corporate strategy.
II. Education:
Engineering bachelor’s degree in software, computer, systems, electrical, or a suitable engineering or technical field required to support Land C4ISR.




Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with one or more of the following Canadian Army C2 Specialty Applications would be an asset:
Fires Automation Targeted Effects System (FATES).
Indirect Fire Control Software Suite (IFCSS).
Engineer Command and Control Information System (EC2IS).
Variable Message Format Processor (VMFP).
Ballistic Calculator Software (BCS).
Director Armament Sustainment Program Management (DASPM).
NATO Sub-Group 2 (SG2) Sharable Software Suite.
Armaments Ballistics Kernel (NABK).
Artillery Systems Cooperation Activities (ASCA); and
Logistics Functional Area Services (LOGFAS).
Regulatory Compliance Requirements
All applicants must be able to obtain a Canadian SECRET Clearance and meet the eligibility requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Registration Program and ITAR.
